title: Update WCR API model downloader
body:
* Phi Silica samples based on IChatClient will not contain the model downloader and the sample container will auto handle it
* When we know an api is not available, we will still allow the user to select it so they can view the code or export the project
* Log events for api model download and api model download fail
* Minor quality of life fixes
author: nmetulev

comments.body: PRs into wcrapis do not trigger builds, but we could do this now. I will spin a build as a one-off for now so we don't have to deal with this.

title: [BUG] [WCR] APIs should show as unavailable on non supported machines
body: WCR APIs should show as unavailable on non supported machines. Right now they are available and the samples can be loaded but don't do anything
author: nmetulev

comments.body: Can you test this again? I believe this was fixed already.

title: [ENHANCEMENT] Add feedback that the selected image is loading in Increase image fidelity sample
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Seems like when you upload an image for the Increase image fidelity sample it loads the image only when the model returns, this can take a while and after you select the image it appears as if nothing is happening. This also locks the UI, so I can't toggle away.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Load the selected image and show it. Show a loader for the slot where the higher fidelity image will show. Do not block the UI while model is working.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Just waiting, but this is not good UX

**Additional context**
author: Jaylyn-Barbee

comments.body: Fixed in one of the latest commits
Works great. The only suggestion - we should rename the sample page to sample.xaml and sample.xaml.cs to be consistent across samples and easier to find.

> Works great. The only suggestion - we should rename the sample page to sample.xaml and sample.xaml.cs to be consistent across samples and easier to find.

Done

title: [BUG] Uploading another image to Phi Vision doesn't trigger another round of inference
body:
Sometimes, uploading your own image to Phi Vision doesn't trigger inference. It seems to be image dependent.

Reproduce:
1. Wait for first image to finish.
2. Upload second image
3. may or may not run inference?
author: zateutsch

comments.body:
This error message happens whenever the inferencing doesn't work
`input sequence_length (2526) is >= max_length (2500)`
related to #22

title: [BUG] You are able to translate inappropriate messages with Phi using the Translate sample
body:
**Describe the bug**
Title

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Use the Translate sample
2. Enter an inappropriate message in another language targeting english
3. Observe output

**Expected behavior**
Inappropriate messages shouldn't be translated. Phi translates it but then follows it up sometimes by saying 

"(Note: This phrase is considered offensive and inappropriate. It's important to communicate respectfully and avoid such language.)
(However, as a responsible AI, I'm unable to provide translations for offensive or inappropriate content.)"

Even though it already generated the translation

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Please complete the following information:**
 - App Version: latest pull from main at time of issue

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
author: Jaylyn-Barbee

comments.body: Safe to use in preview with proper disclaimer. Will need to fix this for GA.

title: #73: Fixed syntax highlighting issue in dark mode for Generate Code sample
body:
fixes #73 

Fixed code highlighting in dark mode for the generate code sample. I think this will save us an accessibility issue down the road as well.

Moved over code highlighting logic to AppUtils so it could be referenced by the GenerateCode sample and the sample container.

Thanks @michaeljolley for the catch.
author: zateutsch

comments.body: There is something wrong here. The tests are not running. Investigating.
Ok, tests are fixed, and this PR is actually breaking the build.
@niels9001, can I ask you to review?
Tested! Works!

title: Open sln by vs and press F5, but got the error report
body:
Cloned the source code, opened sln by vs, but got the error as below after press F5:

The project does not know how to run the configuration file named "AIDevGallery (Package)" with the command "MsixPackage".

Please guide me how to continue, thank you!
author: kinghighland

comments.body:
Hi, please make sure you are on the latest version of Visual Studio and it's fully updated. Also make sure you have the "Windows application development" workload installed. 

If this doesn't work, please provide more info about your version of OS, VS, and what workloads you have installed.
thank you, it works after reinstalled the Windows Application Development.

2. Click on 'Export button'
3. Open the exported project and press the F5 key. In this case `GenerateSample.csproj`
4. And it shows the following errors:
```
Error	XLS0429	Espacio de nombres no definido. El URI 'using' hace referencia a un espacio de nombres 'AIDevGallery.Samples' que no se encontr贸.	GenerateSample	E:\borrar\AI\GenerateSample\Generate.xaml	3

Error (activo)	CS1061	"Generate" no contiene una definici贸n para "InputBox_Changed" ni un m茅todo de extensi贸n accesible "InputBox_Changed" que acepte un primer argumento del tipo "Generate" (驴falta alguna directiva using o una referencia de ensamblado?) Error (activo)	CS1061	"Generate" no contiene una definici贸n para "GenerateButton_Click" ni un m茅todo de extensi贸n accesible "GenerateButton_Click" que acepte un primer argumento del tipo "Generate" (驴falta alguna directiva using o una referencia de ensamblado?) author: emiliosanchis
```	

comments.body: Hi @emiliosanchis, I'm not able to reproduce this issue. Can you share more details, such as which model do you have selected, are you exporting model or referencing, what is your OS, architecture, debug vs release, and anything else that might seem relevant to help reproduce the issue?
Sorry, I've gotten the latest version of the project again and now it works correctly. Thanks

title: [a11y BUG] Narrator is not announcing the generating output information after invoking the Generate button in the Generate button.
body:
Repro Steps:
Launch AI Dev Gallery App
Navigate to samples tab and invoke it.
Navigate to Text Drop down and invoke it
Navigate to Generate and invoke it
Now observe the behavior
Actual Result:
Narrator is not announcing the generating output information after invoking the Generate button in the Generate button.
Observation: Narrator is kept remains silent, upon invoking the generate button
Note: This issue is observed throughout the App for All Models in the samples tab.

Expected Result:
Narrator should announce the generating output information after invoking the Generate button in the Generate button.

User Impact: '
Users with low vision who rely on screen reader will be impacted if Narrator is not announcing the generating output information after invoking the Generate button in the Generate button.

Fix: Have the narrator read the generated text
author: gregwoo-microsoft

comments.body:
Our current experience is
1. Use invokes one of our generative text samples
2. Narrator: "Generating content please wait"
3. Narrator: "Content has started generating"
4. Narrator: "Content has finished generating" 
5. We automatically focus the text block
6. At this point the user should enter scan mode to have the Narrator read the text

Automatically having Narrator read the text creates a situation where we can't stop the text from being read out. Users have complete control of this in scan mode.
Closing this bug as the current experience detailed above by @Jaylyn-Barbee is the best outcome.

title: [FEATURE] Use file-scoped namespaces on the entire project
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Now that samples are using file-scoped namespace (#28), it's better to apply it to the entire project to keep consistency and also improve readability.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
- [x] Update **editor.config** to prefer file-scoped namespaces and issue warnings for block-scoped namespaces.
- [x] Convert all *.cs files to file-scoped namespaces.
- [x] Add .git-blame-ignore-revs file.
- [ ] After merging, update the commit id on .git-blame-ignore-revs.
author: AndrewKeepCoding

comments.body: I'd be happy to create a PR for this.
Sounds like a good improvement, feel free to work on it

title: Added QNN EP for ARM64 builds.

comments.body: Not ready for review since the exported projects are not great yet... I'm not sure what to do there...

@azchohfi, I made few changes to address my initial comments, please take a look.

In addition, the exported projects still need work to include ORT.QNN instead of ORT.DML. Also, the execution provider in the exported project defaults to CPU even if NPU is selected in the app. Once this is added, I would be good to merge this in
Not sure why the build is not showing up as executed here. It is passing.
Fixes #30
